intro: Ossaea scalpta, commonly known as the slender ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. It has narrow, linear leaves that are usually covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Ossaea scalpta is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine by local communities.
